alert.note: Alert for Clay; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 23 at 3:14AM CDT until April 23 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY, GUSTY WINDS, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 009 AND 021... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 009 and 021. * WIND...Southwest winds sustained at 25 to 35 MPH with gusts to around 50 MPH shifting to the west at 15 to 25 MPH with gusts up to 35 MPH in the evening. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity of 17 to 22 percent * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
